name: microsoft-sentinel
label: Microsoft Sentinel
description: Microsoft Sentinel is Cloud-native SIEM for intelligent security analytics for your entire enterprise. These connector connects to Microsoft sentinel using Sentinel APIs to investigate on alerts, threats intelligence indicator, incidents, incident entities, incident relations, incident comments, and incident bookmarks.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: resource
fields.description: The service-based URL to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: The service-based URL to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Tenant ID
fields.name: tenant_id
fields.description: The ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.
fields.tooltip: The ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

fields.title: Client ID
fields.name: client_id
fields.description: Unique ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.
fields.tooltip: Unique ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Client Secret
fields.name: client_secret
fields.description: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.
fields.tooltip: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp.

fields.title: Authorization Code
fields.name: code
fields.tooltip: The authorization code that you acquired in the authorization step.
fields.description: The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Getting Authorization Code using the Generating the Authorization Code section.

fields.title: Workspace Subscription ID
fields.description: Subscription ID of the Microsoft Sentinel that is used to access the Sentinel APIs.
fields.name: WorkspaceSubscriptionId

fields.title: Workspace Resource Group
fields.description: Resource Group of the Microsoft Sentinel that is used to access the Sentinel APIs.
fields.name: WorkspaceResourceGroup

fields.title: Workspace Name
fields.description: Workspace name of the Microsoft Sentinel that is used to access the Sentinel APIs.
fields.name: WorkspaceName

fields.title: Redirect URI
fields.name: redirect_uri
fields.tooltip: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.
fields.description: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. The redirect URL that you specify here must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you have registered in your app registration portal.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Create Threat Intelligence Indicator
operations.description: Creates a threat intelligence indicator in Microsoft Sentinel based on the display name, pattern type, source, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: Display name of the threat represented by the indicator that you want to create in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Pattern Type
parameters.name: patternType
parameters.description: Select a pattern type of the threat indicator to create in Microsoft Sentinel. You can choose from the following options: Domain Name, File, IPV4 Address, IPV6 Address, or URL

Domain Name.title: Domain Name
Domain Name.name: pattern
Domain Name.description: Specify a domain name that you want to create as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

File.title: Hashes
File.name: pattern
File.description: Specify file hashes that you want to create as indicators in Microsoft Sentinel.

IPV4 Address.title: IPV4 Address
IPV4 Address.name: pattern
IPV4 Address.description: Specify an IPV4 address that you want to create as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

IPV6 Address.title: IPV6 Address
IPV6 Address.name: pattern
IPV6 Address.description: Specify an IPV6 address that you want to create as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

URL.title: URL
URL.name: pattern
URL.description: Specify a URL that you want to create as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Source
parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Specify the source of the indicator's threat intelligence entity that you want to create in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Confidence
parameters.name: confidence
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an integer value representing the confidence in the accuracy of the data within the indicator that identifies malicious behavior. You can enter any value between 0-100, where 100 is the highest.
parameters.tooltip: Acceptable values are 0 â€“ 100 with 100 being the highest.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Specify a brief description (100 characters or less) of the threat indicator that you want to create in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: threatIntelligenceTags
parameters.description: Specify tags that you want to assign to the indicator being created in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Threat Type
parameters.name: threatTypes
parameters.description: Type of threat that you want to assign to the indicator that you are creating in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a valid indicator threat type.

parameters.title: Indicator Type
parameters.name: indicatorTypes
parameters.description: Type of indicator that you want to assign to the indicator that you are creating in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a valid indicator type.

parameters.title: Labels
parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Specify indicator labels that you want to assign to the indicator being created in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to create threat intelligence indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.description: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to create threat intelligence indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

operations.title: Get All Threat Intelligence Indicators
operations.description: Retrieves all threat intelligence indicators from Microsoft Sentinel based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Search Query
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Query using which you want to filter indicators to be retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData's Filter query is supported based on fields.
For example [created gt 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z] retrieves all the indicators that are created after 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the query using which you want to filter indicators retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData Filter query is supported based on fields. For example [created gt 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z] retrieves all the indicators that were created after 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc. By default, this is set to asc.
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc.
By default, this is set to asc.

parameters.title: Number of Indicators to Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of indicators that this operation should return from Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Skiptoken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Threat Intelligence Indicator
operations.description: Retrieves a specific threat intelligence indicator from Microsoft Sentinel based on the threat intelligence indicator ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat Intelligence Indicator ID
parameters.description: Specify the indicator ID based on which you want to retrieve the threat intelligence indicator from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: id

operations.title: Update Threat Intelligence Indicator
operations.description: Updates a specific threat intelligence indicator in Microsoft Sentinel based on the threat intelligence indicator ID, display name, pattern type, source, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat Intelligence Indicator ID
parameters.description: Specify a unique GUID or ID, generated by the system after ingestion, based on which you want to update that threat intelligence indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: id

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: Specify the display name of the threat indicator that you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Pattern Type
parameters.name: patternType
parameters.description: Select a pattern type of the indicator that you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel. You can choose from the following options: Domain Name, File, IPV4 Address, IPV6 Address, or URL

Domain Name.title: Domain Name
Domain Name.name: pattern
Domain Name.description: Specify the domain name that you want to update as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

File.title: Hashes
File.name: pattern
File.description: Specify file hashes that you want to update as indicators in Microsoft Sentinel.

IPV4 Address.title: IPV4 Address
IPV4 Address.name: pattern
IPV4 Address.description: Specify an IPV4 address that you want to update as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

IPV6 Address.title: IPV6 Address
IPV6 Address.name: pattern
IPV6 Address.description: Specify an IPV6 address that you want to update as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

URL.title: URL
URL.name: pattern
URL.description: Specify a URL that you want to update as an indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Source
parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Specify the source of the indicator's threat intelligence entity that you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Confidence
parameters.name: confidence
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an integer value representing the confidence in the accuracy of the data within the indicator that identifies malicious behavior. You can enter any value between 0-100, where 100 is the highest.
parameters.tooltip: Acceptable values are 0 â€“ 100 with 100 being the highest.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Specify a brief description (100 characters or less) of the threat indicator that you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: threatIntelligenceTags
parameters.description: Specify tags that you want to assign to the indicator being updated in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Threat Type
parameters.name: threatTypes
parameters.description: Type of threat that you want to assign to the indicator that you are updating in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a valid indicator threat type.

parameters.title: Indicator Type
parameters.name: indicatorTypes
parameters.description: Specify the indicator type that you want to assign to the indicator being updated in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a valid indicator type.

parameters.title: Labels
parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Specify indicator labels that you want to assign to the indicator being updated in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to update indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.description: Specify additional fields, in JSON format, based on which you want to update the threat indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.

operations.title: Delete Threat Intelligence Indicator
operations.description: Deletes a specific threat intelligence indicator in Microsoft Sentinel based on the threat Intelligence Indicator ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat Intelligence Indicator ID
parameters.description: Specify a unique GUID or ID, generated by the system after ingestion, based on which you want to delete that threat indicator in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: id

operations.title: Get Incident List
operations.description: Retrieves all incidents from Microsoft Sentinel based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Created DateTime
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the date and time of the creation of incidents to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: created_datetime
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Created Datetime based on which you want to retrieve incidents from Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Severity
parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the severity of the incident to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel. You can choose from the following options: Critical, High, Medium, Low, or Informational

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the status of the incident to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel. You can choose from the following options: Active, New, or Closed

parameters.title: Search Query
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Query using which you want to filter incidents to be retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData's Filter query is supported based on fields.
For example [classification eq 'FalsePositive'] retrieves all the incidents that classification are FalsePositive
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the query to filter indicators retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData Filter query is supported based on fields. For example, [classification eq 'FalsePositive'] retrieves all the incidents that are classified are FalsePositive.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc. By default, this is set to asc.
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc.
By default, this is set to asc.

parameters.title: Number of Incidents to Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of incidents that this operation should return from Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Skiptoken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Incident Details
operations.description: Retrieves a specific incident from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to retrieve its details from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

operations.title: Get Incident Alert List
operations.description: Retrieves all alerts associated with a specific incident from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to retrieve the associated alerts from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

operations.title: Get Incident Entities List
operations.description: Retrieves all entities associated with a specific incident from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to retrieve associated entities from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

operations.title: Get Incident Bookmarks List
operations.description: Retrieves bookmarks associated with a specific incident from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the incident ID to retrieve associated bookmarks from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

operations.title: Update Incident
operations.description: Updates an incident in Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID, severity, status, title, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Severity
parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the severity of the incident to update in Microsoft Sentinel. You can choose from the following options: Critical, High, Medium, Low, or Informational

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Updates the status of the specific incident in Microsoft Sentinel. You can choose from the following options: Active, New, or Closed

Closed.title: Classification Comment
Closed.name: Comment
Closed.description: Specify a classification comment to associate with the specified incident being closed in Microsoft Sentinel.

Closed.title: Classification
Closed.name: classification
Closed.description: Select a classification reason for the incident being closed in Microsoft Sentinel. You can choose from the following options: BenignPositive, FalsePositive, TruePositive, or Undetermined

Closed.title: Classification Reason
Closed.name: reason
Closed.description: Select a reason justifying the classification of the incident being closed. You can choose from the following options: InaccurateData, IncorrectAlertLogic, SuspiciousActivity, or SuspiciousButExpected.

parameters.title: Title
parameters.name: Title
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a title of the incident to update in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: ETag
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an Etag of the incident to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: etag
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Etag in which you want to update the incident in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a description of the incident to update in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Custom Properties
parameters.name: custom_attributes
parameters.description: Specify additional properties, in JSON format, of the incident to update in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the incident.
parameters.tooltip: Additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to update incident in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the incident.

operations.title: Create Incident Relations
operations.description: Creates incident relations in Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID, relation name, and resource ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify an ID of the incident whose relations you want to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Relation Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the incident whose relations you want to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: relationName

parameters.title: Resource ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the resource whose associated incident relations you want to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: resourceId

operations.title: Get All Incident Relations
operations.description: Retrieves all incident relations from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose relations you want to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Search Query
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Query using which you want to filter incident relations to be retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData's Filter query is supported on fields.
For example [name eq sample] retrieves all the indicators that are equal to specific name.
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the query using which you want to filter incident relations retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData Filter query is supported based on fields. For example [name eq sample] retrieves all the indicators that are equal to the specified name.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc. By default, this is set to asc.
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc.
By default, this is set to asc.

parameters.title: Number of Incident Relations to Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of incident relations that this operation should return from Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Skiptoken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Incident Relation
operations.description: Retrieves a specific relation of an incident from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID and relation name that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose relation you want to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Relation Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the incident relation you want to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: relationName

operations.title: Update Incident Relations
operations.description: Updates incident relations in Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID, relation name, and resource ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose relation you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Relation Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the incident relation you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: relationName

parameters.title: Resource ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the resource whose associated incident relations you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: resourceId

operations.title: Delete Incident Relation
operations.description: Deletes a specific incident relation in Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID and relation name that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify an ID of the incident whose relations you want to delete from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Relation Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the incident relation you want to delete from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: relationName

operations.title: Create Incident Comment
operations.description: Creates an incident comment in Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID and message that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident to which to add a comment in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Message
parameters.description: Specify a message those you want to add to the incident in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: message

operations.title: Get All Incident Comments
operations.description: Retrieves all incident comments from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident ID, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose comments you want to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Search Query
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Query using which you want to filter incident comments to be retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData's Filter query is supported based on fields.
For example [createdDateTime gt 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z] retrieves all the indicators that are created after 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: ((Optional) Specify the query using which you want to filter incident comments retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. The OData Filter query is supported based on fields. For example [created gt 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z] retrieves all the incident comments that were created after 2019-09-22T00:00:00Z

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc. By default, this is set to asc.
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Order in which you want to sort the results retrieved from Microsoft Sentinel. You can specify asc or desc.
By default, this is set to asc.

parameters.title: Number of Incident Comments to Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of incident comments that this operation should return from Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Skiptoken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Incident Comment
operations.description: Retrieves a specific comment of an incident from Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident comment ID and incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Comment ID
parameters.description: Specify the comment ID of the incident whose comments you want to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentcommentId

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose incident comments you want to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

operations.title: Update Incident Comment
operations.description: Updates an incident comment in Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident comment ID, incident ID, and message that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Comment ID
parameters.description: Specify a comment ID of the incident whose comments you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentcommentId

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose comments you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.title: Message
parameters.description: Specify a message whose associate incident comment you want to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: message

operations.title: Delete Incident Comment
operations.description: Deletes a specific incident comment in Microsoft Sentinel based on the incident comment ID and incident ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident Comment ID
parameters.description: Specify the comment ID of the incident whose comments you want to delete from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentcommentId

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose comments you want to delete from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: incidentId

operations.title: Create Watchlist
operations.description: Creates a watchlist in Microsoft Sentinel based on the display name, item search key, provider, source, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.description: Specify a display name of the watchlist to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.tooltip: The value must be between 3 and 64 characters long. Should start with alphabet and end with alphanumeric. The rest may contain hyphens and underscores.

parameters.title: Item Search key
parameters.description: Specify the search key to optimize query performance when using watchlists for joins with other data. For example, enable a column with IP addresses to be the designated SearchKey field, then use this field as the key field when joining other event data by IP address.
parameters.name: itemsSearchKey
parameters.tooltip: The search key is used to optimize query performance when using watchlists for joins with other data. For example, enable a column with IP addresses to be the designated SearchKey field, then use this field as the key field when joining to other event data by IP address.

parameters.title: Provider
parameters.description: Specify the provider of this watchlist to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: provider

parameters.title: Source
parameters.description: Specify the source of the watchlist to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: source
parameters.placeholder: For e.g. Local file or Remote storage

parameters.title: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description of the watchlist to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: description

parameters.title: ETag
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Etag of the watchlist to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: etag
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Etag in which you want to create the watchlist in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Custom Properties
parameters.name: custom_attributes
parameters.description: Specify additional properties, in JSON format, of the watchlist to create in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist.
parameters.tooltip: Additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to create watchlist in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist.

operations.title: Get All Watchlist
operations.description: Retrieves all watchlists from Microsoft Sentinel based on the input parameter you have specified.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Skiptoken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Watchlist
operations.description: Retrieves a specific watchlist without watchlist items from Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist alias that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

operations.title: Update Watchlist
operations.description: Updates a watchlist in Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist alias, display name, item search key, provider, source, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify an alias of the watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.description: Specify the display name of the watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: displayName

parameters.title: Item Search key
parameters.description: Specify the search key to optimize query performance when using watchlists for joins with other data. For example, enable a column with IP addresses to be the designated SearchKey field, then use this field as the key field when joining other event data by IP address.
parameters.name: itemsSearchKey
parameters.tooltip: The search key is used to optimize query performance when using watchlists for joins with other data. For example, enable a column with IP addresses to be the designated SearchKey field, then use this field as the key field when joining to other event data by IP address.

parameters.title: Provider
parameters.description: Specify the provider of this watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: provider

parameters.title: Source
parameters.description: Specify the source of the watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: source
parameters.placeholder: For e.g. Local file or Remote storage

parameters.title: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description of the watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: description

parameters.title: ETag
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Etag of the watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: etag
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Etag in which you want to update the watchlist in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Custom Properties
parameters.name: custom_attributes
parameters.description: Specify additional properties, in JSON format, of the watchlist to update in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist.
parameters.tooltip: Additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to update watchlist in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist.

operations.title: Delete Watchlist
operations.description: Deletes a specific watchlist in Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist alias that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist to delete from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

operations.title: Create Watchlist Item
operations.description: Creates a watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist alias, item key value, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist item to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

parameters.title: Item Key Value
parameters.description: Specify a key-value pair for the watchlist item to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: itemsKeyValue
parameters.tooltip: Specify a key-value pairs for a watchlist item to create the watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Watchlist Item ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the watchlist item to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistItemId

parameters.title: ETag
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Etag of the watchlist item to create in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: etag
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Etag in which you want to create the watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Custom Properties
parameters.name: custom_attributes
parameters.description: Specify additional properties, in JSON format, of the watchlist item to create in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist item.
parameters.tooltip: Additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to create watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist item.

operations.title: Get All Watchlist Items
operations.description: Retrieves all watchlist items from Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist alias, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Skiptoken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Watchlist Item
operations.description: Retrieves a specific watchlist item from Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist item ID and watchlist alias that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Item ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the watchlist item to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistItemId

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist item to retrieve from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

operations.title: Update Watchlist Item
operations.description: Updates a watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist item ID, watchlist alias, item key value, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Item ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the watchlist item to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistItemId

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist item to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistAlias

parameters.title: Item Key Value
parameters.description: Specify the key-value pair for the watchlist item to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: itemsKeyValue
parameters.tooltip: Specify a key-value pairs for a watchlist item to update the watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: ETag
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Etag of the watchlist item to update in Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: etag
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Etag in which you want to update the watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel.

parameters.title: Custom Properties
parameters.name: custom_attributes
parameters.description: Specify additional properties, in JSON format, of the watchlist item to update in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist item.
parameters.tooltip: Additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to update watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the watchlist item.

operations.title: Delete Watchlist Item
operations.description: Deletes a specific watchlist item in Microsoft Sentinel based on the watchlist item ID and watchlist alias that you have specified.

parameters.title: Watchlist Item ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the watchlist item to delete from Microsoft Sentinel.
parameters.name: watchlistItemId

parameters.title: Watchlist Alias
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the watchlist item to delete from Microsoft Sentinel.
